      23             : // sig_safe_t denotes an atomic type which can be read or stored in a single
      24             : // instruction.  This means that data of this type is safe to be manipulated
      25             : // from a signal handler, or other similar asynchronous execution contexts.
      26             : #if defined(XP_WIN)
      27             : typedef unsigned long sig_safe_t;
      28             : #else
      29             : typedef sig_atomic_t sig_safe_t;
      30             : #endif

      32             : namespace detail {
      33             : 
      34             : #if defined(HAVE_THREAD_TLS_KEYWORD) || defined(XP_WIN) || defined(XP_MACOSX)
      35             : #define MOZ_HAS_THREAD_LOCAL
      36             : #endif
      37             : 
      38             : /*
      39             :  * Thread Local Storage helpers.
      40             :  *
      41             :  * Usage:
      42             :  *
      43             :  * Do not directly instantiate this class.  Instead, use the
      44             :  * MOZ_THREAD_LOCAL macro to declare or define instances.  The macro
      45             :  * takes a type name as its argument.
      46             :  *
      47             :  * Declare like this:
      48             :  * extern MOZ_THREAD_LOCAL(int) tlsInt;
      49             :  * Define like this:
      50             :  * MOZ_THREAD_LOCAL(int) tlsInt;
      51             :  * or:
      52             :  * static MOZ_THREAD_LOCAL(int) tlsInt;
      53             :  *
      54             :  * Only static-storage-duration (e.g. global variables, or static class members)
      55             :  * objects of this class should be instantiated. This class relies on
      56             :  * zero-initialization, which is implicit for static-storage-duration objects.
      57             :  * It doesn't have a custom default constructor, to avoid static initializers.
      58             :  *
      59             :  * API usage:
      60             :  *
      61             :  * // Create a TLS item.
      62             :  * //
      63             :  * // Note that init() should be invoked before the first use of set()
      64             :  * // or get().  It is ok to call it multiple times.  This must be
      65             :  * // called in a way that avoids possible races with other threads.
      66             :  * MOZ_THREAD_LOCAL(int) tlsKey;
      67             :  * if (!tlsKey.init()) {
      68             :  *   // deal with the error
      69             :  * }
      70             :  *
      71             :  * // Set the TLS value
      72             :  * tlsKey.set(123);
      73             :  *
      74             :  * // Get the TLS value
      75             :  * int value = tlsKey.get();
      76             :  */
      77             : template<typename T>
      78             : class ThreadLocal
      79             : {
      80             : #ifndef MOZ_HAS_THREAD_LOCAL
      81             :   typedef pthread_key_t key_t;
      82             : 
      83             :   // Integral types narrower than void* must be extended to avoid
      84             :   // warnings from valgrind on some platforms.  This helper type
      85             :   // achieves that without penalizing the common case of ThreadLocals
      86             :   // instantiated using a pointer type.
      87             :   template<typename S>
      88             :   struct Helper
      89             :   {
      90             :     typedef uintptr_t Type;
      91             :   };
      92             : 
      93             :   template<typename S>
      94             :   struct Helper<S *>
      95             :   {
      96             :     typedef S *Type;
      97             :   };
      98             : #endif
      99             : 
     100             :   bool initialized() const {
     101             : #ifdef MOZ_HAS_THREAD_LOCAL
     102             :     return true;
     103             : #else
     104             :     return mInited;
     105             : #endif
     106             :   }
     107             : 
     108             : public:
     109             :   // __thread does not allow non-trivial constructors, but we can
     110             :   // instead rely on zero-initialization.
     111             : #ifndef MOZ_HAS_THREAD_LOCAL
     112             :   ThreadLocal()
     113             :     : mKey(0), mInited(false)
     114             :   {}
     115             : #endif
     116             : 
     117             :   MOZ_MUST_USE inline bool init();
     118             : 
     119             :   inline T get() const;
     120             : 
     121             :   inline void set(const T aValue);
     122             : 
     123             : private:
     124             : #ifdef MOZ_HAS_THREAD_LOCAL
     125             :   T mValue;
     126             : #else
     127             :   key_t mKey;
     128             :   bool mInited;
     129             : #endif
     130             : };
     131             : 
     132             : template<typename T>
     133             : inline bool
     134             : ThreadLocal<T>::init()
     135             : {
     136             :   static_assert(mozilla::IsPointer<T>::value || mozilla::IsIntegral<T>::value,
     137             :                 "mozilla::ThreadLocal must be used with a pointer or "
     138             :                 "integral type");
     139             :   static_assert(sizeof(T) <= sizeof(void*),
     140             :                 "mozilla::ThreadLocal can't be used for types larger than "
     141             :                 "a pointer");

     145             : #else

     147             :     mInited = !pthread_key_create(&mKey, nullptr);

     149             :   return mInited;
